p: Since viruses have plenty of invasion strategies. Each strain of virus has its unique configuration of surface molecules, which work like keys in locks, enabling viruses enter into hosts by accurately fitting the molecules on their surfaces of target cells (Jassim and Naji 2003). Since viruses and hosts are intimately connected, the designing of effective anti-virals that will inhibit the viral enzymes or its replication without affecting the host cells has proved to be difficult (Golean et al. 2009; Chattopadhyay et al. 1999). The public health measures and prophylactic vaccines are still the important means, by which society controls the spread of viral infections.
